intro: Nephrodium rigidum var. americanum, commonly known as the American rigid nephroid, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, often zigzagging stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, textured surface. The flowers are small and clustered, producing a showy display of white or pale pink blooms in late spring to early summer.
